list.title: Question 1
list.content: After solving a problem, John has an exact answer of $z = 0.1475$. - Write down the exact value of $z$ in the form $a\times10^k$, where $1 \leq a < 10, k\in \mathbb{Z}$.[2] - State the value of $z$ given correct to $2$ significant figures. [1] - Calculate the percentage error if $z$ is given correct to $2$ significant figures. [3]
list.markScheme:
- $\answer{1.475\times10^{-1}}$
- $\answer{0.15}$
- Using the percentage error formula
$\epsilon = \bigg|\dfrac{v_\mathrm{A} - v_\mathrm{E}}{v_\mathrm{E}}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\%$
with $v_\mathrm{E} = 0.1475$ and $v_\mathrm{A} = 0.15$, we obtain

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \epsilon &= \bigg|\dfrac{0.15 - 0.1475}{0.1475}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\% \\[6pt]
  &\answer{\approx 1.69\hspace{0.05em}\%}
  \end{aligned}
  $$

list.title: Question 2
list.content: Given that $z = \dfrac{10\sin \alpha}{3x+y}$, where $\alpha = \ang{30}$, $x = 6$ and $y = 46$. - Find the exact value of $z$. [2] - Write your answer to part (a) - correct to $2$ decimal places; - correct to $3$ significant figures; - in the form $a\times10^k$, where $1 \leq a < 10$ and $k\in \mathbb{Z}$.[4]
list.markScheme:
- Substituting $\alpha = \ang{30}$, $x = 6$ and $y = 46$ in the
expression for $z$, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  z &=  \dfrac{10\sin \ang{30}}{3(6)+46} \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 0.078125}\end{aligned}
  $$

- 
  - $\answer{0.08}$
  - $\answer{0.0781}$
  - $\answer{7.81\times10^{-2}}$

list.title: Question 3
list.content: Let $A = \sqrt{\dfrac{\sin \alpha - \sin \beta}{x^2 + 2y}}$, where $\alpha = \ang{54}$, $\beta = \ang{18}$, $x = 24$ and $y = 18.25$. - Find the value of $A$. Write down your full calculator display. [2] - Give your answer to part (a) correct to - three significant figures; - three decimal places. [2] - Give the answer to part (b) (i) in the form $a\times10^k$, where $1 \leq a < 10$, $k \in \mathbb{Z}$.[2]
list.markScheme:
- Substituting $\alpha = \ang{54}$, $\beta = \ang{18}$, $x = 24$ and
$y = 18.25$ in the expression for $A$, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  A &= \sqrt{\dfrac{\sin \ang{54} - \sin \ang{18}}{24^2 + 2(18.25)}} \\[6pt]
  &\answer{\approx 0.028571}\end{aligned}
  $$

- 
  - $\answer{0.0286}$
  - $\answer{0.029}$

- $\answer{2.86\times10^{-2}}$

list.title: Question 4
list.content: Let $Q = \dfrac{(\sin 2x + b)(2\sin x - 1)}{a^2 - 4\tan x}$, where $x = \ang{45}$, $a = 18$ and $b = \sqrt{2}$. - Find the exact value of $Q$. [2] - Give your answer to part (a) correct to - three decimal places; - three significant figures. [2] - Calculate the percentage error if $Q$ is given to three decimal places. [2]
list.markScheme:
- Substituting $x = \ang{45}$, $a = 18$ and $b = \sqrt{2}$ in the
expression for $Q$, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  Q &= \dfrac{(\sin \ang{90} + \sqrt{2})(2\sin \ang{45} - 1)}{18^2 - 4\tan \ang{45}} \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 0.003125}\end{aligned}
  $$

- 
  - $\answer{0.003}$
  - $\answer{0.00313}$

- Using the percentage error formula
$\epsilon = \bigg|\dfrac{v_\mathrm{A} - v_\mathrm{E}}{v_\mathrm{E}}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\%$
with $v_\mathrm{E} = 0.003125$ and $v_\mathrm{A} = 0.003$, we obtain

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \epsilon &= \bigg|\dfrac{0.003 - 0.003125}{0.003125}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\% \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 4\hspace{0.05em}\%}
  \end{aligned}
  $$

list.title: Question 5
list.content: The volume of a hemisphere, $V$, is given by the formula $$ V = \sqrt{\dfrac{4S^3}{243\pi}}\hspace{0.05em}, $$ where $S$ is the total surface area. The total surface area of a given hemisphere is $529$ cm$^2$. - Calculate the volume of this hemisphere in cm$^3$. Give your answer correct to one decimal place. [3] - Write down your answer to part (a) correct to the nearest integer. [1] - Write down your answer to part (b) in the form $a\times10^k$, where $1 \leq a < 10$ and $k \in \mathbb{Z}$.[2]
list.markScheme:
- Substituting $S = 529$ in the volume of a hemisphere formula, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  V &= \sqrt{\dfrac{4(529)^3}{243\pi}} \\[6pt]
  &\answer{\approx 880.7\hspace{0.25em}\text{cm}^3}\end{aligned}
  $$

- $\answer{881\hspace{0.25em}\text{cm}^3}$
- $\answer{8.81\times10^2\hspace{0.25em}\text{cm}^3}$

list.title: Question 6
list.content: Four cement bags labelled, "5 kg", were delivered to a customer. The customer measured each bag to check their weights and recorded the following: $$ \begin{aligned} 4.92,\hspace{0.3em} 4.95,\hspace{0.3em} 5.02,\hspace{0.3em}4.95 \\ \end{aligned} $$ - - Find the mean of the customer's measurements. - Calculate the percentage error between the mean and the stated, approximate weight of $5$ kg. [3] - Calculate $\sqrt{2.15^8-5.12^{-0.8}}$, giving your answer - correct to the nearest integer; - in the form $a\times10^k$, where $1 \leq a < 10$ and $k\in \mathbb{Z}$. [3]
list.markScheme:
- 
  - If we calculate the mean of the measurements, we get

    $$
    \begin{aligned}
    \hspace{2.8em} \mu &=  \dfrac{4.92 + 4.95 + 5.02 + 4.95}{4} \\[6pt]
    &\answer{= 4.96}\end{aligned}
    $$

  - Using the percentage error formula
$\epsilon = \bigg|\dfrac{v_\mathrm{A} - v_\mathrm{E}}{v_\mathrm{E}}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\%$
with $v_\mathrm{E} = 4.96$ and $v_\mathrm{A} = 5$, we obtain

    $$
    \begin{aligned}
    \epsilon &= \bigg|\dfrac{5 - 4.96}{4.96}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\% \\[6pt]
    &\answer{= 0.81\hspace{0.05em}\%}
    \end{aligned}
    $$


- 
  - $\answer{21}$
  - $\answer{2.14\times10^1}$

list.title: Question 7
list.content: The distance between two points with coordinates $(x_1,y_1)$ and $(x_2,y_2)$ is equal to $\sqrt{(x_2-x_1)^2+(y_2-y_1)^2}$. - Calculate the distance between points A$(40,-100)$ and B$(1,-2)$. Give your answer correct to three significant figures. [3] - Give your answer from part (a) correct to one decimal place. [1] - Write the answer to part (b) in the form $a\times10^k$, where $1 \leq a < 10$, $k \in \mathbb{Z}$. [2]
list.markScheme:
- The distance between points A$(40,-100)$ and B$(1,-2)$ is

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \mathrm{AB} &= \sqrt{(1-40)^2+(-2-(-100))^2} \\[8pt]
  &\approx 105.475 \\[8pt]
  &\answer{\approx 105} \end{aligned}
  $$

- $\answer{105.5}$
- $\answer{1.055\times10^2}$

list.title: Question 8
list.content: The following diagram shows a rectangle with sides of length $7.6\times10^2$ cm and $1.5\times10^3$ cm. ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/b941e1fd-194d-4791-af1f-5051b95d132b/images/44cb6de2-68db-48c4-ae43-e4d84077333c/95dfeaca3907795a90048551ee5f6c3d7e41c444.svg) - Write down the area of the rectangle in the form $a\times10^k$, where $1 \leq a < 10$ and $k \in \mathbb{Z}$. [3] Natalie estimates the area of the rectangle to be $1\hspace{0.1em}200\hspace{0.15em}000$ cm$^2$. - Find the percentage error in Natalie's estimate. [3]

list.title: Question 9
list.content: Let $F = \dfrac{(4\sin 2z-1)(2\tan 3z+1)}{x^2-y^2}$, where $x = 12$, $y = 8$ and $z = \ang{15}$. - Calculate the exact value of $F$. [2] - Give your answer to $F$ correct to - two significant figures; - two decimal places. [2] Sasha estimates the value of $F$ to be $0.03$. - Calculate the percentage error in Sasha's estimate. [2]
list.markScheme:
- Substituting $x = 12$, $y = 8$ and $z = \ang{15}$ in the expression
for $F$, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{1.55em} F &= \dfrac{(4\sin \ang{30}-1)(2\tan \ang{45}+1)}{12^2-8^2} \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 0.0375}\end{aligned}
  $$

- 
  - $\answer{0.038}$
  - $\answer{0.04}$

- Using the percentage error formula
$\epsilon = \bigg|\dfrac{v_\mathrm{A} - v_\mathrm{E}}{v_\mathrm{E}}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\%$
with $v_\mathrm{E} = 0.0375$ and $v_\mathrm{A} = 0.03$, we obtain

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \epsilon &= \bigg|\dfrac{0.03 - 0.0375}{0.0375}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\% \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 20\hspace{0.05em}\%}
  \end{aligned}
  $$

list.title: Question 10
list.content: Given $r = 2a - \dfrac{\sqrt{b}}{c}$, $a = 0.975$, $b = 4.41$ and $c = 35$, - calculate the value of $r$. [2] Albert first writes $a$, $b$ and $c$ correct to one significant figure and then uses these values to estimate the value of $r$. - - Write down $a$, $b$ and $c$ each correct to one significant figure. - Find Albert's estimate of the value of $r$. [2] - Calculate the percentage error in Albert's estimate of the value of $r$. [2]
list.markScheme:
- Substituting $a = 0.975$, $b = 4.41$ and $c = 35$ in the expression
for $r$, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{2em} r &= 2(0.975) - \dfrac{\sqrt{4.41}}{35} \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 1.89}\end{aligned}
  $$

- 
  - $\answer{a = 1,\, b = 4,\, c = 40}$
  - Substituting $a = 1$, $b = 4$ and $c = 40$ in the expression for
$r$, we get

    $$
    \begin{aligned}
    r &= 2(1) - \dfrac{\sqrt{4}}{40} \hspace{3.3em} \\[6pt]
    &\answer{= 1.95}\end{aligned}
    $$


- Using the percentage error formula
$\epsilon = \bigg|\dfrac{v_\mathrm{A} - v_\mathrm{E}}{v_\mathrm{E}}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\%$
with $v_\mathrm{E} = 1.89$ and $v_\mathrm{A} = 1.95$, we obtain

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{3.75em} \epsilon &= \bigg|\dfrac{1.95 - 1.89}{1.89}\bigg|\times 100\hspace{0.05em}\% \\[6pt]
  &\answer{\approx 3.17\hspace{0.05em}\%}
  \end{aligned}
  $$

list.title: Question 11
list.content: Jurgen is a scientist working for NASA. He maintains a telescope that is in orbit around the Earth. To test the accuracy of the telescope he uses it to measure the radius of the Earth. The radius of the Earth is known to be $6\hspace{0.1em}378\hspace{0.1em}137$ metres. - Jurgen measures the radius of the Earth to be $6\hspace{0.1em}432\hspace{0.1em}400$ metres. What is the percentage error in his measurement? [2] Jurgen uses his measurement to calculate the circumference of the Earth. He assumes the Earth is spherical. - - What value for the circumference of the Earth does Jurgen obtain? Round your answer to $4$ significant figures. - Write down the answer to part (b)(i) in the form $a\times10^k$, where $1\leq a<10$ and $k\in \mathbb{Z}$. [3]

list.title: Question 12
list.content: A cuboid has the following dimensions: $\text{length} = 9.6\hspace{0.25em}$cm, $\text{width} = 7.4\hspace{0.25em}$cm, and $\text{height} = 5.2\hspace{0.25em}$cm, measured correct to the nearest millimetre. - Using these measurements, calculate the volume of the cuboid, in cm$^3$. Give your answer to two decimal places. [2] The lower and upper bounds for the length of the cuboid can be expressed as $9.55 \leq l < 9.65$. - Write similar expressions for - the width; - the height. [2] - Hence, calculate the minimum volume of the cuboid. Give your answer to three significant figures. [2] - Write your answer to part (c) in the form $a\times10^k$, where $1 \leq a < 10$ and $k \in \mathbb{Z}$. [2]
list.markScheme:
- Using the volume of a cuboid formula $V = l \times w \times h$, we
get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  V &= 9.6\times7.4\times5.2 \\[6pt]
  &= 369.408 \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 369.41\hspace{0.25em}\mathrm{cm}^3 \text{ (2 d.p.)}} 
  \end{aligned}
  $$

- 
  - $\answer{7.35 \leq w < 7.45}$
  - $\answer{5.15 \leq h < 5.25}$

- Using the lower bound for each dimension, and the volume formula, we get

  $$
  \begin{align*}
  V &= 9.55\times7.35\times5.15 \\[6pt]
  &= 361.491... \\[6pt]
  &\tcbhighmath{= 361\hspace{0.25em}\mathrm{cm}^3 \text{ ($3$ s.f.)}}
  \end{align*}
  $$

- $\answer{3.61\times10^2}$
